Description: Fifteen cylindrical cornelian beads, probably from a necklace or bracelet; pierced for suspension; polished.
Curator's comments: See Peltenburg 1986, 163-4 for a discussion of cornelian on Late Bronze Age Cyprus, where an Egyptian source is suggested. The more diagnostic types of cornelian beads and pendants occur in LC IIC, part of a broader expandion of Egyptian goods into the Levant and Cyprus, though the form of the present items is very simple and less dateable by type alone. Bibliography: Peltenburg E. 1986, 'Ramesside Egypt and Cyprus', in ed. V. Karageorghis, Cyprus between the Orient and the Occident (Nicosia), 149-79.
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (671)
SCE IV/1D / The Swedish Cyprus Expedition. Vol. IV. Part 1D. The Late Cypriot Bronze Age. Other arts and crafts (p. 546)
